dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, big news this week, Host_B. President Trump actually signed the Hong Kong human rights bill into law.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, big news this week, Host_B. President Trump actually signed the Hong Kong human rights bill into law.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Topline: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, after days of uncertainty surrounding his willingness to confront Beijing as he attempts to hammer out a trade deal with China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, honestly, I was a little surprised. Like, for days, it felt like there was so much uncertainty around that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, honestly, I was a little surprised. Like, for days, it felt like there was so much uncertainty around that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Until today it was unclear if Trump would sign the bill into law.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally, right? Because, you know, he's been trying to, um, hammer out this trade deal with China, so there was always that question of whether he'd really confront Beijing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally, right? Because, you know, he's been trying to, um, hammer out this trade deal with China, so there was always that question of whether he'd really confront Beijing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Topline: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, after days of uncertainty surrounding his willingness to confront Beijing as he attempts to hammer out a trade deal with China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, it passed almost unanimously in both houses of Congress. Like, it's a big deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, it passed almost unanimously in both houses of Congress. Like, it's a big deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, was passed almost unanimously by both houses of Congress last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. It basically says the president *has* to impose sanctions against people found violating human rights there, and the State Department needs to send annual reports to Congress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. It basically says the president has to impose sanctions against people found violating human rights there, and the State Department needs to send annual reports to Congress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would mandate that the president impose sanctions against people found to be violating human rights in Hong Kong and require the State Department to give Congress annual reports assessing whether China has encroached on Hong Kongs autonomy or clamped down on civil liberties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, assessing if China's, like, encroaching on their autonomy or civil liberties. But what did Trump *say* when he signed it? I heard it was a bit...odd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, assessing if China's, like, encroaching on their autonomy or civil liberties. But what did Trump say when he signed it? I heard it was a bit...odd.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and require the State Department to give Congress annual reports assessing whether China has encroached on Hong Kongs autonomy or clamped down on civil liberties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah. He said he signed it "out of respect for President Xi, China, and the people of Hong Kong." And then, like, hoped leaders could "amicably settle their differences."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah. He said he signed it "out of respect for President Xi, China, and the people of Hong Kong." And then, like, hoped leaders could "amicably settle their differences."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a statement announcing the signing, Trump said he signed the bill out of respect for President Xi, China and the people of Hong Kong. They are being enacted in the hope that Leaders and Representatives of China and Hong Kong will be able to amicably settle their differences leading to long-term peace and prosperity for all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is interesting given how quiet he's been on Hong Kong until now. Remember that Fox interview where he said he's "standing with Hong Kong" *but also* "standing with President Xi"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting given how quiet he's been on Hong Kong until now. Remember that Fox interview where he said he's "standing with Hong Kong" but also "standing with President Xi"?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president has been relatively silent on Hong Kong as he negotiates a trade deal with Chinas President Xi Jinping. In an interview on Fox and Friends last week, Trump said, We have to stand with Hong Kong, but Im also standing with President Xi, when asked if he would sign the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. It's that classic balancing act, I guess. But Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill, he called it "new and meaningful tools" to deter Beijing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. It's that classic balancing act, I guess. But Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill, he called it "new and meaningful tools" to deter Beijing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Crucial quote: The U.S. now has new and meaningful tools to deter further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kongs internal affairs, said Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And he pointed out how timely it is, especially after those historic elections in Hong Kong with the record turnout. Like, it really shows strong U.S. support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he pointed out how timely it is, especially after those historic elections in Hong Kong with the record turnout. Like, it really shows strong U S support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following last weekends historic elections in Hong Kong that included record turnout, this new law could not be more timely in showing strong U.S. support for Hong Kongers long-cherished freedoms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And let's not forget how this whole thing started, right? Months ago, with that controversial extradition bill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And let's not forget how this whole thing started, right? Months ago, with that controversial extradition bill.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News peg: Pro-democracy protests erupted in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong months ago over a bill that would extradite those accused of committing a crime in Hong Kong to mainland China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the one that would've, like, sent people accused of crimes in Hong Kong to mainland China. The worry was always political opponents being targeted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the one that would've, like, sent people accused of crimes in Hong Kong to mainland China. The worry was always political opponents being targeted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The worry was the law would be used to crack down on political opponents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, even though that bill was withdrawn, the protests just kept going. It really morphed into this huge movement against Beijing's control.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, even though that bill was withdrawn, the protests just kept going. It really morphed into this huge movement against Beijing's control.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the bill has been withdrawn from consideration, the protests have become a larger movement against Beijings control over the city, sometimes devolving into violent clashes between protesters and police officers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it's been, like, super intense. Sometimes devolving into those really violent clashes between protesters and police. So, this signing, it's a pretty significant moment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's been, like, super intense. Sometimes devolving into those really violent clashes between protesters and police. So, this signing, it's a pretty significant moment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the protests have become a larger movement against Beijings control over the city, sometimes devolving into violent clashes between protesters and police officers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It, uh, puts the US firmly on record, even with all the trade deal complexities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It, uh, puts the U S firmly on record, even with all the trade deal complexities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. It'll be interesting to see how China reacts, um, and what comes next.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. It'll be interesting to see how China reacts, um, and what comes next.
